column4: have you installed the packages? (tomcat5, tomcat5-admin, tomcat5-webapps)
i did not find any of these packages. mom, i will look again for them
oops, sorry, those exist for dapper only at the moment.
i do not know which packet i have to download on tomcat.apache.org
it would be a lot easier if you could use Ubuntu packages. You don't want to test the prerelease version of Ubuntu, by any chance?
how should i come to deb-packets?
they are in the dapper repositories. I reckon you could download the dapper sources and make your own breezy packages.
i did see this on the german wiki ;)
but is this no problem when i install software from dapper in my breezy? i mean because of the dependencies
your English is ganz prima. Installing dapper packages in breezy will cause you more problems than installing dapper outright...
also check out https://wiki.ubuntu.com/CompilingSoftware -- what's missing in there, though, is apt-get source
do you know about apt-get source ?
no i don't. i do not download the source from the repos. and i have commented it out in the sources.list
i am not that good in compiling linux -.-
if you can live with an unstable & still buggy system, your best bet is to upgrade to dapper. I'll have a quick look at upstream, though. Hold on...
oh, no i do not have a flatrate. this would explode my data-transfer-limit
my dapper upgrade download was less than 1GB on a fairly complete system...
from looking at the Apache Tomcat pages, it appears to be a fairly complex project to install.
